TopicTitle: [0.24.2] Voice Commander 1.3.2 - Control crafts with your voice

Articles.Content:
setup is not in the toolbar.

Leider wird der setup bildschirm in toolbar niocht angezeigt. voiceserver ist gestartet
Works fine for me. Can you give more details?

have the last toolbar install 1.7.5 . Voicecommander dir is at correct place: gamedata /blizzy/VoiceCommander.

Mechjeb is at aktulle version.Microfon testet with win 7 microfon konfigurator are working fine.

at toolbar plugin can i not found the voicecommander in setup screen.

Work voiceCommander only 32 Bit ?

Edited July 25, 2014 by Prismatech

Please make a copy of voiceserver.exe somewhere outside of KSP, then start that copy. After that, start KSP. Do not start the voiceserver.exe copy inside of your KSP folder.

This seems to be a problem on some versions of Windows. For example, it does not occur on mine.

when i start voiceserver.exe out of ksp dir have i this bug behind "test 1 2 3"

orginal Voiceserver.exe is at the voicedir have make a copie to dektop

Edit : have as test the voicecommand.dll to the other dir then have i not the bug must i copie second the mechjeb dll too?

Edited July 25, 2014 by Prismatech

Edit : have as test the voicecommand.dll to the other dir then have i not the bug must i copie second the mechjeb dll too?

I'm sorry, my mistake. Yes, the VoiceCommander.dll is required. No, the VoiceCommanderMechJeb.dll is not required.

Voice Commander 1.3.2 is now available for download.

Note: If the download page is linking an older version for you, press F5 in your browser.

Also note that I've modified the installation instructions in the OP.

Blizz great mod, btw.

Just curious, I know you have a ton of other mods, but where you still planning on updating Voice Commander to .25?
I'm not sure actually. The userbase is surprisingly small, so I'm wondering whether it's worth the work.
If it's just a recompile then go for it.

I'm not sure actually. The userbase is surprisingly small, so I'm wondering whether it's worth the work.

Hate to hear that. But you have a dedicated fan here. Love the Role Play flavor it adds.

I agree that if it's a recompile only, hopefully. I say it's worth it. (of course, since I'm not the compiler)

Would hate to see this fade out.

I've just posted a thread to announce that I'm looking for a plugin developer to take over this plugin.

Meanwhile, I'm halting all development on this plugin. It's been a good time so far. Thank you all for your input and support.
